scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You then acknowledged their frustration but emphasized the importance of focusing on what can be controlled. Next, [Monica] leaned forward, exasperated. 'Focusing on what we can control is fine, but what about the lack of time?' [Bob] chimed in, 'Yeah, we're still going to need more hours in the day to get this done.' You then suggested prioritizing tasks by importance. Now, [Monica] sighs heavily and throws her hands up in frustration. 'Prioritizing is good, but we still don't have enough people to handle the critical tasks.' [Bob] shakes his head, 'We need more hands on deck.'
scenes.description: [Monica] looks at you expectantly, while [Bob] seems to be waiting for a concrete solution.

options.text: Let's reach out to other departments to see if we can borrow some team members.
options.analysis: You suggested seeking help from other departments, showing good emotional perception and empathy.

options.text: I understand the manpower issue. We might need to prioritize and delegate more effectively.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the manpower issue and suggested better delegation, demonstrating balanced emotional intelligence.

options.text: We're all in this together. Let's dig deep and push through as a team.
options.analysis: You focused on team unity and motivation, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
